title: Integrating Information Technology in Science Education Through Problem-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and foundational knowledge in scientific disciplines
context.additional_context: Workplace education for professionals aiming to enhance information technology utilization skills in scientific research and tasks, involving real-time collaboration and problem-solving activities using individual devices.

learning_goals: Learners can utilize at least three spreadsheet/statistical software functions for scientific data analysis
Learners can independently search for resources to solve real-world work problems using web-based scientific information sources

In teams of 3â€“4, learners analyze two problem-based learning scenarios in science and technology (e.g., renewable energy optimization, data-driven urban design). Using collaboration tools (Google Docs, Miro, etc.), they propose solutions following a three-stage process (problem definition, solution derivation, outcome evaluation) and achieve an average score of 4 or higher (on a 5-point scale) in peer and instructor feedback.
Learners can understand principles of technology-enhanced instructional design and design simple science education modules

resources: Online Collaboration Tools (Miro, Google Workspace, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
